14.saint: Our holy father and confessor Martin, pope of Rome

main.text: ,   Guide to Orthodoxy, teacher of piety and holiness, * luminary for the world, * inspired adornments of monks [ or  bishops], * O wise Martin, Harp of the Spirit, * you enlightened all by your teachings; * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

additional.text: ,   You disowned earthly wealth and glory, O holy martyrs, * and you bravely endured torture for the faith. * You walked willingly into death for the life of the Lord, * and Christ has guided you with a pillar of cloud. * With glory and honor he has crowned you at his throne. * Standing there we ask you to pray for our salvation.

main.text: You set out firmly with priestly devotion * and completed the course in martyrdom. * You passed into heaven, O wise Martin, * and received laurels which will never fade. * Now we come to celebrate your holy memory, crying out: * As you stand before Christ, remember us, O martyr.

15.saint: The holy apostles Aristarchus, Pudens, and Trophimus

main.text: O holy Apostles, intercede with the merciful God * that he may grant our souls forgiveness of sins.
This precious feast is  truly apostolic, * for it enlightens us and dispels the fog of sin for those who sing: * The Light has been shown to us, * and deliverance is at hand.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Through all the earth their voice resounds; * their message reaches to the end of the world.

16.saint: The holy martyrs Agape, Irene, and Chiona

main.text: You finished the race and kept the faith. * By martyrdom you were led to Christ * the Lamb and Shepherd, O rational lambs. * Therefore,  today, with a joyful heart, * O most wondrous women, * extolling Christ, we celebrate your holy memory.

Having pledged yourselves to the Lord so gracefully, * you made an offering of your blood at your martyrdom. * O holy martyrs, * you have been admitted to heaven's banquet hall * and the splendid brilliance of the Light himself. * As we celebrate your holy memory, * we bless the Savior and we cry out: * Pray to the Lord for all of us.

prokeimenon.text: God is wondrous in his saints, the God of Israel.
prokeimenon.verse: In the churches bless God; from Israel's wellsprings bless the Lord.

verses: I have waited, waited for the Lord, and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.
He drew me out of the pit of destruction, out of the filthy clay.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

17.saint: Our venerable father Simeon of Saba in Persia, bishop of Seleucis and Ctesiphon

main.text: God of our fathers, you always deal with us in your kindness. * Take not your mercy away from us; * but through their prayers guide our life in peace.

Your memory has become clearer than sunlight, O holy Simeon and blessed Acacius. * As good pastors you enlighten the faithful. * We now keep your memory and cry out: * Beg the only true Lover of us all to save us.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

18.saint: Our venerable father John, disciple of the holy Gregory the Decapolite

main.text: In you, O father, the divine image was strictly preserved; * taking up your cross, you followed Christ. * You taught us by example how to spurn the flesh, for it passes away, * and how to care for the soul, which is immortal. * Therefore, O venerable John, your soul rejoices with the angels.

Adorning your life with chastity, O father, * you disciplined your body. * You overcame the attacks of the foe, O blessed saint, * and you presented yourself before God * to enjoy the life of unending bliss you so richly deserve, O John. * Pray to the Lord for our salvation.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

19.saint: Our venerable father John of the ancient cave

main.text: In you, O father, the divine image was strictly preserved; * taking up your cross, you followed Christ. * You taught us by example how to spurn the flesh, for it passes away, * and how to care for the soul, which is immortal. * Therefore, O venerable John, your soul rejoices with the angels.

You gave up food, wealth, and fame, * and you lived as a wanderer in the deserts. * You withered your body by your abstinence, * and with courage you passed your life in silence. * For this we sing to you, * O venerable model of virtue: * Beg Christ our God to forgive the sins * of those who lovingly cherish your memory.

main.text: Your abundant tears made the wilderness bloom, * and your sufferings   made your labors fruitful a hundredfold; * you became a shining torch   over the world. * O venerable father Theodore, * pray to Christ our God   that he may save our souls.

You became famous for your life, O wise father Theodore. * For, dressed in the rough garment of a hairshirt, you won treasures of heaven * which surpass those of any king. * Now you have  traded your laborer's garb for heaven's robes. * Pray unceasingly for all of us, * O venerable father.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.

21.saint: The holy bishop martyr Januarius and his companions Proculus, Sonius and Faustus (deacons), Desiderius (lector), Eutyches and Akutionus

main.text: Anointed with the grace of the priesthood, you became good shepherds for God's people. * You were snatched and eaten like sheep, but you were offered like a sacrifice to God * in imitation of your Master who was slaughtered like a lamb. * Pray for us who hold fast to your cherished memory.

You were anointed with the chrism of the priesthood, * and washed in the blood of martyrdom. * You are radiant as you sing praises in heaven's halls. * Guard those who come to your temple and sing: * Preserve us who supplicate Christ our God.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.

22.saint: Our venerable father Theodore the Sykiot

main.text: Having followed the path of the holy from your youth, * you became a vessel full of graces. * You graced the world with miracles, O priestly Theodore, * and you cast out many devils. * Now pray to the Lord for all of us.

Ascending by virtue as if in a chariot of fire, * you took up your abode in heaven, O God-bearing one. * You lived on earth like an angel in the flesh, * and now you sing praises with the angels in heaven. * You became a heavenly fount of miracles, O Theodore.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

24.saint: The holy martyr Sabbas the Goth

main.text: Casting off the robes of dignity and honor, O martyr, * you confessed Christ before the torturer, the evil king. * For this you were subjected to great suffering, O glorious one, * and you obtained a crown of victory from the King of all. * You have been placed among heaven's legions. * Therefore, pray for the salvation of our souls, O Sabbas.

Showing yourself an invincible Goth, * you slew the barbarians. * Enduring a martyrdom of extreme cruelty,  * you crushed legions of unseen devils. * You assumed a crown of victory, O blessed Sabbas, * and we ask you to intercede with Christ our God.

prokeimenon.text: The just man will rejoice in the Lord, * and will put his trust in him.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear my voice, O God, when I pray to you.

verses: The just man will flourish like the palm tree * and grow like a cedar of Lebanon.
Planted in the house of the Lord, he will flourish in the courts of our God.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

26.saint: The holy martyr Basil, bishop of Amasea in Pontus

main.text: You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Basil, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.
By disobeying the edict of the king, you gained heaven. * As you now raise your song there, * remember us who commemorate you, * O priest-martyr Basil.

This precious feast is  truly apostolic, * for it enlightens us and dispels the fog of sin for those who sing: * The Light has been shown to us, * and deliverance is at hand.

main.text: As we celebrate the memory of your prophet Jeremiah, O Lord, * we implore you to save our souls through his prayers.

O great prophet and martyr, you received the gift of prophecy * after you purified your heart by the fire of the Spirit. * How loudly you proclaimed the message, O Jeremiah: * This is our God, and you shall have none other before him. * He has taken on flesh and has appeared on earth.

prokeimenon.text: You are a priest forever * according to the order of Melchizedek.
prokeimenon.verse: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand * till I make your enemies your footstool.

verses: Moses and Aaron were among his priests; Samuel was among those who called upon his name.
Light dawns for the just, and gladness for the upright of heart.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

2.saint: Our holy father Athanasius the Great, archbishop of Alexandria,

main.text: You were a pillar of Orthodoxy, supporting the Church. * You preached that the Son was of one nature with the Father; * O venerable Athanasius, you made Arius blush with shame. * Beg Christ our God to have mercy on us.
Blaring trumpet of the Lord and flute of the Spirit, * O great Athanasius, O fiery mind, * it is fitting to sing your praises with hymns; * for you taught us to honor the Trinity of one essence.

prokeimenon.text: My lips will speak * words of wisdom; * understanding will be the theme of my heart.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear this, all you nations; give heed, all who dwell in the world.

verses: The mouth of the just will utter wisdom, and his tongue will pronounce judgment.
The law of the Lord is in his heart; his steps shall be saved from stumbling.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

3.saint: The holy martyr Timothy and his wife Maura

main.text: Loving the monastic life from your youth, * you climbed the summit of virtue. * Achieving your goal, you took up life in a cave. * Perfecting your life by fasting, you became like an angel. * You have enlightened all the Slav lands like a star. * O father Theodosius, intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

additional.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: We venerate the star of all the Slav lands today, * rising in the East and travelling to the West. * The blessed Theodosius radiated miracles and holiness * by his goodness and monastic piety.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: Your lamb Pelagia, O   Jesus, cries out in a loud voice: * I love you, my Bridegroom; I seek   you with painful longing. * I am crucified with you; in your baptism, I   am buried with you; *I suffer for you that I may reign with you; * and I   die for you that I may live with you. * Receive me as a spotless   sacrifice immolated with love for you. * By her prayers, O merciful One,   save our souls.

Having inflamed your soul with love for Christ, * you entered the boiling pot with courage. * You became a sacrifice pleasing in aroma to the Lord. * Today we remember you, * O wise Pelagia, and we sing to you.

prokeimenon.text: God is wondrous in his saints, the God of Israel.
prokeimenon.verse: In the churches bless God; from Israel's wellsprings bless the Lord.

verses: I have waited, waited for the Lord, and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.

5.saint: The holy and glorious martyr Irene, at Thessalonica in Macedonia

main.text: Your lamb Irene, O   Jesus, cries out in a loud voice: * I love you, my Bridegroom; I seek   you with painful longing. * I am crucified with you; in your baptism, I   am buried with you; *I suffer for you that I may reign with you; * and I   die for you that I may live with you. * Receive me as a spotless   sacrifice immolated with love for you. * By her prayers, O merciful One,   save our souls.

Anointed with the sweetness of virginity, * you were beautiful in your martyrdom, O virgin Irene. * Robed in crimson from your blood, you exposed the lies of the godless. * For this the Creator crowned you in triumph.

prokeimenon.text: God is wondrous in his saints, the God of Israel.
prokeimenon.verse: In the churches bless God; from Israel's wellsprings bless the Lord.

verses: I have waited, waited for the Lord, and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

6.saint: The holy and just Job, the Long-Suffering,

main.text: When then enemy of the just beheld the treasures of Job's virtues, * he sought to destroy them. * He attacked his body but could not touch his spirit, * for his pure soul was well-armed. * As for us, the same enemy stripped us and chained us. * Therefore, O Savior, be on our side, * protect us against the devil and save us.

Shown to be truthful and righteous, * pious, blameless and sanctified, * O most    glorious one,  true favorite of God, * you have  enlightened the world with your    patience, O most patient and valiant one. * Wherefore, O t you who are divinely wise,    * we all sing a hymn to your  memory.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

7.saint: The appearance of the Sign of the Cross in the heavens

main.text: The sign of your cross appeared in a dazzling glow * more radiant than the sun. * O Savior, you stretched it from the holy mountain * to the place of Calvary, * manifesting in this way the power you have given to it. * Preserve our civil authorities in strength * and establish our country in peace * through the prayers of the Theotokos.

The pure and life-giving cross which opened paradise * appeared in splendor over the earth * and extended its dazzling rays to the heavens. * Today, we faithful accept its radiance as our guide to the Eternal Light. * We bear it in our struggles * as an assurance of victory and triumph.

prokeimenon.text: Exalt the Lord our God and worship at his foot-stool, for he is holy.
prokeimenon.verse: The Lord is King; let the peoples rage.

verses: Remember your flock which you acquired long ago.
God is our king from all ages. He has accomplished salvation in the middle of the earth.

communion_hymn.text: . We have been signed, O Lord, with the light of your face.

8.saint: The holy apostle and evangelist John the Theologian

main.text: Beloved apostle of Christ our God, * hasten to deliver a people that lacks any other defense. * He who accepted that you lay your head on his breast * will also acceptr your prayer. * Pray to Christ, O Theologian, * that he may overcome the darkness of pagan nations, * and beg that he grant us peace and abundant mercy.

O man of purity, who could describe your glory? * Many are the miracles and healings you perform. * Since you a theologian and the beloved of Christ, * intercede with him for the salvation of our souls.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Through all the earth their voice resounds; * their message reaches to the end of the world.

main.text: A day of festal joy has come. * The city of Bari rejoices, * and the world sings with it. * Today we celebrate the transfer of the relics * of the wonder-working and holy Nicholas. * Just as the perfect Light has gleamed in glory, * so does Nicholas disperse the darkness of temptation * for those who sing out: * Save us as patron, O Nicholas.

additional.text: As we celebrate the memory of your prophet Isaiah, O Lord, * we implore you to save our souls through his prayers.

In garments most lovely, woven from your blood, * you stand before the King of heaven. * For you chant the Thrice-Holy Hymn with angels and martyrs. * Through your prayers, ask the Savior to save our souls.

main.text: Like a star rising in the East, your relics have arisen and come to the West. * The waters of the sea have been hallowed by your passage, * and the city of Bari has received grace from you. * You are truly a most wonderful miracle-worker and a merciful prelate; * therefore, we praise you.

prokeimenon.text: Let the faithful rejoice in glory, * shout for joy, and take their rest.
prokeimenon.verse: Sing to the Lord a new song of praise in the assembly of the faithful.

verses: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.
The Lord has chosen Zion; he prefers her for his dwelling.

. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

10.saint: The holy apostle Simon the Zealot

main.text: O holy Apostle Simon ,  intercede with the merciful God * that he may grant our souls forgiveness of sins.

With holy hymns we bless Simon as a preacher of God, * who rooted wisdom deeply in the hearts of the pious. * Now he stands before the throne of glory * and rejoices in the company of angels. * He prays unceasingly for all of us.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Through all the earth their voice resounds; * their message reaches to the end of the world.

main.text: As equals of the apostles and teachers of the Slavs, * beg the Master of all to confirm us in the faith * and in unity of heart, O Cyril and Methodius. * Beg him for peace in the world * and mercy on our souls.

We honor those priests who gave us the Light, * who opened the fountain of  theology for us by translating the Holy Scriptures, * thus starting a river from them that still runs today. * We glorify you, O Cyril and Methodius, * who stand in heaven before the throne of the Lord on high, * and who pray so fervently for all of us.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.

verses: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.

12.saint: Our holy father Epiphanius, bishop at Salamina in Cyprus.

main.text: ,    God of our fathers, you always deal with us in your kindness. * Take not your mercy away from us; * but through their prayers guide our life in peace.

O faithful, let us sing a hymn worthy of praise * in honor of the two glorious bishops, * Epiphanius and Germanus. * They enlightened the minds of those without faith, * and to the faithful they presented God's great mysteries, * explaining true belief with great wisdom.

prokeimenon.text: My lips will speak * words of wisdom; * understanding will be the theme of my heart.

    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: Your lamb Glyceria, O   Jesus, cries out in a loud voice: * I love you, my Bridegroom; I seek   you with painful longing. * I am crucified with you; in your baptism, I   am buried with you; *I suffer for you that I may reign with you; * and I   die for you that I may live with you. * Receive me as a spotless   sacrifice immolated with love for you. * By her prayers, O merciful One,   save our souls.

O Glyceria, you loved the Virgin Mary, Mother of God, * and consecrated your virginity to Christ. * Aflame with love for the Lord, you fought the good fight until death. * For this, O martyed virgin, Christ our God crowns you with a double crown.

prokeimenon.text: God is wondrous in his saints, the God of Israel.
prokeimenon.verse: In the churches bless God; from Israel's wellsprings bless the Lord.

verses: I have waited, waited for the Lord, and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: Your  martyr Isidore, O Lord our God, * in his struggle, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, he brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through his prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.
O glorious Isidore, through your constant prayers  to God, * you became a leader in the world * and a martyr holy in spirit. * Therefore, we sing hymns of praise to you.

prokeimenon.text: The just man will rejoice in the Lord, * and will put his trust in him.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear my voice, O God, when I pray to you.

verses: The just man will flourish like the palm tree * and grow like a cedar of Lebanon.
Planted in the house of the Lord, he will flourish in the courts of our God.

. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

15.saint: Our venerable father Pachomius the Great

main.text: Your abundant tears made the wilderness bloom, * and your sufferings   made your labors fruitful a hundredfold; * you became a shining torch   over the world. * O venerable father Pachomius, * pray to Christ our God   that he may save our souls.

You became a light for the ends of the earth. * You peopled the desert with monks like a city. * You weakened your body by your abstinence. * You took up your cross and crucified yourself. * Pray unceasingly for all of us.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: You made the wilderness your dwelling, * O father Theodore, the bearer of God. * You became an angel in the flesh and a wonder-worker. * Through fasts, vigils and prayers, you obtained from God special graces to heal the sick * and to sanctify the souls of those who come you with trust. * Glory to the One who gave you strength! * Glory to the One who crowned you! * Glory to the One who through your intercession grants healing to all!
You bloomed like a flower in the house of God, * bearing the fragrant fruit of virtue through your fasting. * You have been made an equal of angels for this, O venerable father.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

17.saint: The holy apostle Andronicus and his companions.

main.text: O holy Apostle Andronicus, intercede with the merciful God * that he may grant our souls forgiveness of sins.

We praise Andronicus, the apostle of Christ, * the bright star who enlightened the pagans * with understanding of God. * Who also praise Junius who labored along with him * in bringing the Gospel to the pagans. * We cry out: Implore God for us unceasingly.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Through all the earth their voice resounds; * their message reaches to the end of the world.

18.saint: The holy martyr Theodotus of Ancyra

main.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.
You fought well by your martyrdom, O Theodotus, * as did those who were martyred with you. * You were crowned along with those martyred virgins. * Implore Christ our God unceasingly for all of us.

prokeimenon.text: To all the saints in his land, * the Lord has shown all the wonders of his will.
prokeimenon.verse: I set the Lord ever before me; with him at my right hand I shall not be disturbed.

verses: The just cried out and the Lord heard them, and rescued them from all their distress.
Many are the trials of the just, but from them all the Lord will rescue them.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

19.saint: The holy martyr Patrick, bishop of Prusa, and his companions,

main.text: You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Patrick, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.
As a beacon fed by the virtues of the priesthood, * you were emblazoned with the blood of martyrdom. * Standing before Christ with those who died with you, * remember us, O precious martyr Patrick.

prokeimenon.text: Let the faithful rejoice in glory, * shout for joy, and take their rest.
prokeimenon.verse: Sing to the Lord a new song of praise in the assembly of the faithful.

verses: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.
The Lord has chosen Zion; he prefers her for his dwelling.

communion_hymn.text:
.

main.text: Your  martyr  Thaleleus, O Lord our God, * in his struggle, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, he brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through his prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

Becoming a companion of martyrs and a good warrior, * you were a pleasing soldier to Christ, the King of Glory. * You wiped out the glory of idols by endurance and pain; * therefore, O wise Thaleleus, we praise your memory.

21.saint: The holy emperor Constantine and his mother Helen, equal to the apostles.

main.text: Seeing the cross in the sky like Paul, * like him you received a call from the Divine. * You committed the royal city into the hands of the Lord. * Save this city always in peace, O only Lover of us all, * through the prayers of the Theotokos.

Today, Constantine and his mother reveal the cross, * that most precious tree which puzzles the Jews. * It is the armor of Christian authorities against enemies. * It has proved itself awesome in war by its many miracles.

verses: I have exalted one chosen from the people.
O Lord, your strength gives joy to the king; how your saving help makes him glad.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Through all the earth their voice resounds; * their message reaches to the end of the world.

main.text: Your  martyr  Basiliscus, O Lord our God, * in his struggle, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, he brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through his prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

You stood firmly with fortitude in your sufferings. * You astonish us with your wonderful miracles * which promote the name of Christ among us. * You shamed the devil, and so we venerate you, calling out: * Rejoice, O Basilicus, * dearest and most brilliant of martyrs.

23.saint: Our venerable father and confessor Michael, bishop of Synnada

main.text: ,    Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Michael, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

As a dear prelate and a holy martyred priest, * you did not fear the threats of the evil one. * You fought heretical forces by proclaiming: * I reverence the icon of Christ * and that of his most pure Mother. * For this we honor you, O Michael.

prokeimenon.text: My lips will speak * words of wisdom; * understanding will be the theme of my heart.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear this, all you nations; give heed, all who dwell in the world.

verses: The mouth of the just will utter wisdom, and his tongue will pronounce judgment.

main.text: ,    You made the wilderness your dwelling,  * O father Simeon, the bearer of God.  You became an angel in the flesh and a wonder-worker. * Through fasts, vigils and prayers, * you obtained from God special graces to heal the sick * and to sanctify the souls of those who come to you with trust. * Glory to the one who gave you strength! * Glory to the one who crowned you! * Glory to the one who through your intercession grants healing to all!

additional.text: In you, O father, the divine image was strictly preserved; * taking up your cross, you followed Christ. * You taught us by example how to spurn the flesh, for it passes away, * and how to care for the soul, which is immortal. * Therefore, O venerable Nicetas, your souls rejoices with the angels.

main.text: You turned from the things of earth to search for  those of heaven. * You built a tower in which you lived as in another heaven, * manifesting your miracles upon the earth. * O venerable father, intercede unceasingly * with Christ our God for all of us.

25.saint: The third finding of the head of the holy prophet, forerunner, and Baptist, John

main.text: Like a heavenly treasure hidden in a field, * Christ has revealed your head for us, O prophet. * Having gathered together at its discovery, * we sing hymns to the Savior * who delivers us by your prayers.

O heavenly light and divine pillar of the world, * O lamp-stand of the sun, * the light-bearing and divine head of the Forerunner * was discovered and revealed to the whole world. * It sanctified those who in faith venerate it and who cry out: * O most wise Baptizer of Christ, save all of us.

26.saint: The holy apostle Carpus, one of the Seventy.

main.text: O holy Apostle Carpus, intercede with the merciful God * that he may grant our souls forgiveness of sins.

O apostle Carpus, the Church has gained you for all time as a brilliant star, * enlightening it with the multitude of your miracles. * Therefore, we cry out to Christ: * O most merciful Lord, save those who in faith honor the memory of your apostle.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

27.saint: The holy bishop martyr Therapont of Sardis

main.text: You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Therapont, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.

Having suffered under the law, O Therapont, * you became a true pastor and martyr. * You were a champion for God and sowe come to you for favors. * Ease our souls of uncontrollable passion * and beseech Christ who loves us in his mercy.

28.saint: Our venerable father Nicetas, bishop of Chalcedon.

main.text: ,    Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Nicetas, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

You were resplendent from your good works, O Nicetas, * and you inherited the apostolic seat, O venerable father. * You beamed like the sun over your flock, * radiating all of the divine dogmas. * That is why we sing to you: * Rejoice, O inspiration of Chalcedon.

29.saint: The holy venerable martyr and virgin Theodosia.

main.text: You were a friend of Christ and a dwelling of the Spirit, * and  you embraced the blessing of martyrdom joyfully. * You shamed the enemy who wars against the human race.  * You slew Copronymus by your patient endurance. * You entered heaven by the sword of faith. * Seek mercy and peace for those who venerate you.

By your labors you obtained a life of rest and peace. * By shedding your blood you vanquished the enemy of Christ's Church. * WIth the heavenly hosts you now rejoice in heaven, O Theodosia, * and shelter those who honor your memory.

verses: I have waited, waited for the Lord, and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.
He drew me out of the pit of destruction, out of the filthy clay.

    The just woman will be remembered forever; evil news she will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

30.saint: Our venerable father Isaac, hegumen of the Dalmatian Monastery

main.text: In you, O father, the divine image was strictly preserved; * taking up your cross, you followed Christ. * You taught us by example how to spurn the flesh, for it passes away, * and how to care for the soul, which is immortal. * Therefore, O venerable Isaac, your souls rejoices with the angels.

As a champion of God, * you were inflamed with zeal for the Church of Christ. * Grasping the bridle of Valentian, * you warned him of a horrible death. * You foretold terrible events if the Churches remained closed * to those of the true faith. * Therefore, we venerate you, O Isaac, * and ask you to pray for us in turn.

31.saint: The holy apostle Hermes, bishop of Philippi

main.text: O holy Apostle Hermes, intercede with the merciful God * that he may grant our souls forgiveness of sins.

additional.text: Your  martyr Hermeas, O Lord our God, * in his struggle, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, he brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through his prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: You glimmered over the earth like a star, * supporting Paul, that beam from the divine Light * who enlightened the whole world. * Therefore, O Hermes, we venerate you.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

1.saint: The holy martyr Justin and his companions.

main.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

additional.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: Embellished by the wisdom of your heavenly words, * all of God's Church tells the world of your holy life. * Receiving a crown in return for your blood, * you stand before Christ in the company of angels  and pray unceasingly for all of us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: When, through the plots of the enemy, * the deepest darkness mastered all creation, * so that it worshiped a multitude of idols,  * then you put an end to this darkness, * and with  fervent love and faith * you poured out your blood for him * who shed his blood upon the Cross.

Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: ,    Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Nicephor, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

additional.text: ,    The grace of your deep words and lofty teaching * has become a ladder to virtue for us. * You possessed a trumpet of the spirit, O Father, * and by it you announce spiritual teaching.  * You have taken up your abode in paradise, * but still confound enemies with the might of your words. * O blessed Nicephor, * beg Christ to forgive the sins of those who honor you.

,    Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Nicephor, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

main.text: Since you have received the crown of victory from God,  * save those who appeal to you in faith, * O glorious Nicephor,  for you are a prince of Christ’s priests and a teacher for us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: We recognize you as a foundation of truth, a firm support of the faith, a rampart of sacred teaching, a defender of religion, a temple of purity, a chosen urn of the fragrance of the Spirit, a treasury of instruction, upon which the Church of  Christ rests, O holy bishop Nicephor.

As the rightful high priest, you entered into the divine, unending tabernacle of truth, established by the Lord, O venerable father, with your own blood, not with another's, not submitting to the counsel of the torturers, but allying yourself with God to the end.

,    Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Nicephor, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

3.saint: The holy martyr Lucillian and his companions.

main.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

additional.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: You approached the fire but were not burned, * O courageous and wise martyr Lucillian. * You possessed the cooling dew of God. * You and your companions surpassed nature; * therefore, we ask all of you to remember us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: Consumed by jealousy * the deadly children of the murderers of the Lord betrayed you. * Triumphing by your courage, O Lucillian, * you received the joys of Paradise. * Continually intercede * that our souls be given peace and great mercy.

Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

additional.text: Resplendent with heavenly belief, * you made a sacrifice of yourself to God. * In suffering martyrdom for the Immortal King, * you have inherited the heavenly palace. * O venerable father Dorotheus, * in your joy pray to Christ to have mercy on all of us.

You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Dorotheus, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.

Resplendent with heavenly belief, * you made a sacrifice of yourself to God. * In suffering martyrdom for the Immortal King, * you have inherited the heavenly palace. * O venerable father Dorotheus, * in your joy pray to Christ to have mercy on all of us.

main.text: More radiant than the sun because of your good works, * your heavenly teaching and your suffering, * you shed light on the world, O blessed Dorotheus. * You burnt off the stubborn mist of  worship of idols * and the fog of every trace of heresy. * Therefore, we now rejoice in your memory.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: You were shown to be the tablet of the Spirit of God, * O divinely blessed father, * and you bore the doctrine of God engraved on your mind; * in disclosing it, you illumined those who dwelt in ignorance. * Therefopre, by your supplication, O father, * ask for great mercy for us all.

You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Dorotheus, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.

Resplendent with heavenly belief, * you made a sacrifice of yourself to God. * In suffering martyrdom for the Immortal King, * you have inherited the heavenly palace. * O venerable father Dorotheus, * in your joy pray to Christ to have mercy on all of us.

prokeimenon.text: Let the faithful rejoice in glory, * shout for joy, and take their rest.
prokeimenon.verse: Sing to the Lord a new song of praise in the assembly of the faithful.

verses: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.
The Lord has chosen Zion; he prefers her for his dwelling.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

6.saint: Our venerable father Bessarion the Wonder-worker

main.text: God of our fathers, you always deal with us in your kindness. * Take not your mercy away from us; * but through their prayers guide our life in peace.

additional.text: God of our fathers, you always deal with us in your kindness. * Take not your mercy away from us; * but through their prayers guide our life in peace.

main.text: Imitating the powers of heaven, O venerable father, * you lived a soaring life like a bird,  * flying upward with unquenchable desire to Christ the King until you reached him. * O Bessarion, pray unceasingly for all of us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: You were the light of monastics, O wise Bessarion, * and by the rays of your virtues * and the radiance of grace  you were like a lamp in the desert.  * From the gloom of the passions and the darkness of the wicked,  * from all sorrow and temptation, * deliver those who fervently honor you and hymn with faith your divine repose.

Having lived an irreproachable life * in patience, gentleness, compunction, * unfeigned charity, self-mastery, * night- long vigils, faith, hope and compassion, * you seemed to be an angel in a body on earth, * O blessed father Hilarion. * Intercede for our souls before God.
God of our fathers, you always deal with us in your kindness. * Take not your mercy away from us; * but through their prayers guide our life in peace.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Theodotus, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.

additional.text: You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Theodotus, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.

main.text:
Enlightening creation with miracles and sufferings, * you were truly a star of light, O blessed Theodotus. * 
    Celebrating your famous memory today, * we praise Christ    with a heart full of joy.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text:
With a joyful heart, you bravely went to your struggles,    * O holy martyr, * fearing neither painful torments nor violent death; * thus, O Theodotus, * you were crowned with    light after fighting the good fight.  
  
    By the rending of your flesh, * you slew the enemy, O    blessed one; * and your words pierced their hearts like arrows. * With the streams of your own blood, * you put a    complete halt to the encroaching waves of the godless.

You shared in the apostles’ way of life * and succeeded to their throne, * divinely inspired bishop.  * You found access to contemplation in the active life.  * Therefore, you rightly taught the word of truth * and struggled for the faith to the shedding of your blood. * O priest-martyr Theodotus, * pray to Christ our God to save our souls.

prokeimenon.text: Let the faithful rejoice in glory, * shout for joy, and take their rest.
prokeimenon.verse: Sing to the Lord a new song of praise in the assembly of the faithful.

verses: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.
The Lord has chosen Zion; he prefers her for his dwelling.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

8.saint: The translation of the relics of the holy great martyr Theodore the Recruit

main.text: You became a brilliant general * in the real armies of the King of heaven, * O Theodore the Triumphant. * You fought courageously with the weapons of faith * and put the legions of demons to flight. * Therefore we praise you with fervor at all times.

additional.text: You became a brilliant general * in the real armies of the King of heaven, * O Theodore the Triumphant. * You fought courageously with the weapons of faith * and put the legions of demons to flight. * Therefore we praise you with fervor at all times.

main.text: O Theodore, pride of martyrs, you put on the armor of faith * and took the Word of God as a spear to vanquish the enemy. * In the company of the martyrs, * do not cease to intercede with Christ our God in behalf of all of us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: You brought yourself * p  wholly to him who have you perfect life, * O most blessed one, * as a living and animate whole-burnt offering, * a sacrifice * most pure and well-pleasing!* Wherefore you have become * a most acceptable intercessor, * thus rescuing * from the tempest all that hymn you with faith * and call upon you, O martyr Theodore.

In the Spirit, you showed yourself * to be a generous athlete, an invincible solder. * You overthrew the enemy * by the wisdom of your words * and the endurance you showed in your struggle. * Thus you received the crown of victory * and joined the festive assembly in heaven, * O Theodore, the glory of martyrs.

Today the honored memory of Christ's passion-bearer * shines forth more brightly than the morning star, * invisibily illumining the hearts of the faithful * and dispelling the clouds from their souls through the grace of the Holy Spirit. * To him let us cry out, O lovers of the martyrs: * O divinely-bestowed grace revealed to the faithful, * which spreads forth multitudes of miracles on those who flee to you, blessed Theodore! * Unceasingly entreat Christ, * fail not to obtain eternal bkessings * for them that honor your memory with faith.

You became a brilliant general * in the real armies of the King of heaven, * O Theodore the Triumphant. * You fought courageously with the weapons of faith * and put the legions of demons to flight. * Therefore we praise you with fervor at all times.

prokeimenon.text: The just man will rejoice in the Lord, * and will put his trust in him.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear my voice, O God, when I pray to you.

verses: The just man will flourish like the palm tree * and grow like a cedar of Lebanon.
Planted in the house of the Lord, he will flourish in the courts of our God.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

9.saint: Our holy father Cyril, bishop of Alexandria.

main.text: Your words reveal a treasure of theology for the world, * and they crushed the blasphemy of Nestor. * You defended the true glory of the Theotokos, O father Cyril. * Now pray to Christ to have mercy on us.

additional.text: Your words reveal a treasure of theology for the world, * and they crushed the blasphemy of Nestor. * You defended the true glory of the Theotokos, O father Cyril. * Now pray to Christ to have mercy on us.

main.text: From the fountain of dogma you poured knowledge on us. * With this same water from the Savior you drowned heresy. * You also protected your flock from terrible storms, * and you are a beacon for everyone, O blessed Cyril. * You reveal divine things to us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: Your mind illumined by the light of the Spirit, * you became a radiant sun, * shining your teachings like rays upon the whole world. * You gave light to the assembly of believers, O blessed father Cyril, * and drove back the darkness of heresy * by the power of the mystic Sun who rose from the Virgin.

O good and faithful servant, laborer in the vineyard of Christ, * you bore the burden of the day, * and increased the talent entrusted to you; * and you did not envy those who came after you. * Therefore, the doors of heaven have been opened to you: * enter into the joy of your Lord, * and pray for us, O Cyril our father.

Your words reveal a treasure of theology for the world, * and they crushed the blasphemy of Nestor. * You defended the true glory of the Theotokos, O father Cyril. * Now pray to Christ to have mercy on us.

prokeimenon.text: My lips will speak * words of wisdom; * understanding will be the theme of my heart.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear this, all you nations; give heed, all who dwell in the world.

verses: The mouth of the just will utter wisdom, and his tongue will pronounce judgment.
The law of the Lord is in his heart; his steps shall be saved from stumbling.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: The world rejoices in singing your praise. * How joyful is this assembly of the faithful for you. * We celebrate your memory and sing: * Save us from all misfortune, O Timothy, by your prayers.  (Consider revising)

additional.text: The world rejoices in singing your praise. * How joyful is this assembly of the faithful for you. * We celebrate your memory and sing: * Save us from all misfortune, O Timothy, by your prayers.  (Consider revising)

main.text: Washed by the rivers of your own blood, O martyred priest, * you offerred the fruit if your heart to Christ from the earth. * You received in return and unending abundance from God. * Beg him to save from misfortune all who venerate you.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text:
Standing above earthly things * like a living cloud, O most blessed one, * you cast down the perverse serpent * with the thunderclaps of your miracles * and the awesome lightning-flashes of your words! * You receive the grace to destroy the Evil One * with the divine covering of the sacred Gifts.  
  
    O holy bishop Timothy, * boast of the people of Prusa, * universal champion and worldwide beacon, * adornment of the Church, sacred sacrifice of faith, * and precious and lustrous ornament of martyrs, * pray that those who celebrate your most honored memory with faith * may be delivered from corruption and misfortune.

The world rejoices in singing your praise. * How joyful is this assembly of the faithful for you. * We celebrate your memory and sing: * Save us from all misfortune, O Timothy, by your prayers.  (Consider revising)

prokeimenon.text: Let the faithful rejoice in glory, * shout for joy, and take their rest.
prokeimenon.verse: Sing to the Lord a new song of praise in the assembly of the faithful.

verses: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.
The Lord has chosen Zion; he prefers her for his dwelling.

communion_hymn.text:
.

11.saint: The holy Apostles Bartholomew and Barnabas.

main.text: Receiving the Spirit as he came in fiery tongues, * you preached the coming of the Word in the flesh. * While one of you sacrificed his head  (or:  was beheaded )  for the gospel, * the other endured stoning for the sake of the faith. * You have been sent to adorn the choirs of heaven, * O Bartholomew and Barnabas. * We honor your memory * and ask that you intercede with God to forgive our sins.

additional.text: Receiving the Spirit as he came in fiery tongues, * you preached the coming of the Word in the flesh. * While one of you sacrificed his head  (or:  was beheaded )  for the gospel, * the other endured stoning for the sake of the faith. * You have been sent to adorn the choirs of heaven, * O Bartholomew and Barnabas. * We honor your memory * and ask that you intercede with God to forgive our sins.

main.text: You have been shown to be a great sun for the whole world, shining with the radiance of doctrines and awesome miracles, and illumining those who honor you, O Bartholomew, apostle of the Lord.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: As you proclaimed the Word of God, O holy Apostle, using your tongue as a net, you drew the whole world up from the depths of vain idolatry and deadly godlessness, in order to lead it to Christ in faith, to that God who had given you grace as his chosen disciple, O Bartholomew.  (twice)

Holy Apostle, you received invincible might over demons and the power to drive out the very prince of darkness in the name of Christ. Like the sun, you traveled about giving light to the whole world. Being the first to arrive in Rome, O glorious Barnabas, you proclaimed there the saving coming of Christ our God.

O all-praised Barnabas, radiant vessel of the Holy Spirit and son of consolation, even before Paul you were the foremost of the seventy disciples, and with Paul you preached the Gospel to the ends of the earth. Therefore, fulfilling your discourse of grace with your deeds, you offered yourself to be a pure holocaust to Christ your Teacher. We pray: beg always, O glorious apostle, that our souls be saved.

stichera_aposticha.text: Through all the earth, your saving voice resounds, enlightening lost souls, O holy Apostles Bartholomew and Barnabas, eye-witnesses of God. In grace, you led enlightened humankind to Christ. Intercede before him that our souls be given peace and great mercy.
stichera_aposticha.verse:
The holy Apostles Bartholomew and Barnabas. Barnabas was a good man and  "full of the Holy Spirit and of faith.”  He was counted among the first of the faithful at Jerusalem, preached the Gospel at Antioch and introduced Saul of Tarsus, just converted, to a number of the brothers.  He accompanied Paul in his first trip to Asia to evangelize.  He was present at the Council of Jerusalem.  Having returned to the island of Cyprus, his native land, he spread the Gospel there.
        Bartholomew the apostle, who is believed by many to be the same as Nathanael, was born in Cana of Galilee and was taken to Christ Jesus by Philip at the Jordan.  Afterwards, the Lord called him to follow him and he joined the Twelve.  After the Ascension of the Lord it is said that he preached the Gospel in India and there was crowned with martyrdom.

stichera_aposticha.text: Shining lights, most pure vessels of Jesus Christ, you received complete enlightenment from the Spirit in faith. Pillars of the Church, wondrous heavens declaring the glory of God: intercede before him that our souls be given peace and great mercy.
stichera_aposticha.verse: Through all the earth their voice resounds; their message reaches to the ends of the world.

stichera_aposticha.text: O blessed ones, you led to Christ our God the nations redeemed by the blood of him who willed to be born on earth and to die on the Cross. Intercede before him that our souls be given peace and great mercy.
stichera_aposticha.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.

stichera_aposticha.text: O all-praised Barnabas, apostle of the Savior, vessel of faith, son of consolation, calm of the storm-tossed, as you have boldness, pray without ceasing, that our souls be kept in peace on this day of your commemoration.
stichera_aposticha.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.

verses: The heavens declare your wonders, O Lord, and your truth in the assembly of the holy.
God is glorified in the council of the holy, great and awesome above all who surround him.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Through all the earth their voice resounds; * their message reaches to the end of the world.

12.saint: Our venerable father Onuphry the Grea

main.text: You became a brilliant general * in the real armies of the King of heaven, * O Theodore the Triumphant. * You fought courageously with the weapons of faith * and put the legions of demons to flight. * Therefore we praise you with fervor at all times.

additional.text: You entered the desert, being led by spiritual yearning;  * and you fought in it for many years like an angel.  * You are the equal of Elijah and the Baptist,  * and you were delighted by the sacred mysteries ministered by angel hands.  * Now that you have gone to them in the Trinity’s light,  * pray for us who venerate your memory.

The mountain of Athos rejolces, * inviting all the monastic choirs to praise you.  * We join with them in singing to you, * O venerable Peter,  * and we lay our petition before you:  * Seek peace for the world and mercy for our souls.

main.text: Illumined by the light of the most Holy Spirit, * you turned your back on the distractions of this life. * Taking up your life in the desert, O venerable father,  * you greatly pleased God our Creator. * For this reason, Christ exalts you, O blessed saint.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: O divinely-wise father Onuphry, * you cut yourself off from the tumult of the world, * and ascended to celestial perfection, * having desired him who is the Source of all good things; * and there you attained true love, O blessed one. * Illumined with that true light, * rescue us from the darkness of sin * by your supplications.

We have recognized you, O venerable one, * as the namesake of the divine Peter, * who truly followed him * and piously shared in his zeal for the Faith; * for you loved the good Law and desired its divine precepts, O father, * and adorned your souls with all the virtues. * Wherefore, we honor and bless you.

O venerable father, * the whole world is filled with   the fame of your holy deeds; * through them, you have received the   recompense of your labors in heaven. * You destroyed hordes of demons *   and have been united to the choirs of angels, * whose pure lives you   imitated. * By your boldness with Christ our God, ask peace for our   souls!

stichera_aposticha.text: Having preserved unharmed * that which was created according to the image of God, * and through fasting established your mind * over all pernicious passions * to arrive at the likeness of God, * insofar as you were able. * Having manfully done violence to your nature, * you strove to make the baser subject to the higher, * enslaving the flesh to the spirit. * By this you have been show to be the summit of monastics, * citizens of the desert, teachers of those who run the good race, * the manifest rule of the virtues. * And now in heaven, where you no longer see through a glass darkly * but behold the Holy Trinity in purity, * pray for those who honor you with faith and love.
stichera_aposticha.verse:
Our venerable father Onuphry the Great, anchorite, who piously spent his life for sixty years in the desolate wilderness.  (400)
Our venerable father Peter of Mount Athos, a soldier by profession.  Captured and imprisoned by the Arabs, he was miraculously freed.  He immediately set out for Rome, where he was tonsured a monk by the Pope.  He was guided in a vision to Mt. Athos, and spent thirty-five years in the ascetic life.  (734)

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: Your lamb Aquilina, O   Jesus, cries out in a loud voice: * I love you, my Bridegroom; I seek   you with painful longing. * I am crucified with you; in your baptism, I   am buried with you; *I suffer for you that I may reign with you; * and I   die for you that I may live with you. * Receive me as a spotless   sacrifice immolated with love for you. * By her prayers, O merciful One,   save our souls.

additional.text: Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Triphyllus, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

Your lamb Aquilina, O   Jesus, cries out in a loud voice: * I love you, my Bridegroom; I seek   you with painful longing. * I am crucified with you; in your baptism, I   am buried with you; *I suffer for you that I may reign with you; * and I   die for you that I may live with you. * Receive me as a spotless   sacrifice immolated with love for you. * By her prayers, O merciful One,   save our souls.

Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Triphyllus, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

main.text: Purifying your soul by the balm of virginity,  * you soared to heaven in a flight of martyrdom.  * You languished with love of Christ, O precious saint,  * and now you can stand before Him, O Aquilina.  * Join the angels in unceasing prayer for us on earth.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: We celebrate your radiant memorial, * O martyr victorious in combat, * virginal bride made resplendent by the Holy Spirit. * With faith, we bow before your holy reliquary *drawing from it healing for our sufferings. * We rightly glorify you, O Aquilina, * all-worthy of acclamations.

O glorious father Triphyllus,  * excellently enlightened with many tears,  * you took wing to the first Cause of the good * and were shown to be a pillar of light, * illumining with your words and miracles * all who with divinely dutiful thought  approach you. * Therefore, we honor you and call you blessed.

Your lamb Aquilina, O   Jesus, cries out in a loud voice: * I love you, my Bridegroom; I seek   you with painful longing. * I am crucified with you; in your baptism, I   am buried with you; *I suffer for you that I may reign with you; * and I   die for you that I may live with you. * Receive me as a spotless   sacrifice immolated with love for you. * By her prayers, O merciful One,   save our souls.

Your life has shown you to your flock as a rule of faith, * an image of gentleness, and a teacher of moderation. * You acquired greatness through humility * and wealth through poverty. * O father and bishop Triphyllus, * intercede with Christ our God to save our souls.

prokeimenon.text: God is wondrous in his saints, the God of Israel.
prokeimenon.verse: In the churches bless God; from Israel's wellsprings bless the Lord.

verses: I have waited, waited for the Lord, and he stooped toward me and heard my cry.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: An angel in the flesh, the foundation of the prophets, * and the second foreruner of Christ, * the glorious Elijah from on high sent grace to Elisha * to cure sicknesses and cleanse lepers. * He likewise overflows with healing for those who honor him.  (same as the troparion of Elijah; cf. July 20)

additional.text: Burning with zeal for the holy icons, O most wise saint,  * you boldly opposed the malice of the king.  * You were locked in a tomb and suffered torment,  * and for your labors you were exiled.  * Do not forget us who sing of your fame, * O most blessed pastor Methodius.

An angel in the flesh, the foundation of the prophets, * and the second foreruner of Christ, * the glorious Elijah from on high sent grace to Elisha * to cure sicknesses and cleanse lepers. * He likewise overflows with healing for those who honor him.  (same as the troparion of Elijah; cf. July 20) .

Burning with zeal for the holy icons, O most wise saint,  * you boldly opposed the malice of the king.  * You were locked in a tomb and suffered torment,  * and for your labors you were exiled.  * Do not forget us who sing of your fame, * O most blessed pastor Methodius.

main.text: O blessed Elisha, you lived the life of a prophet of God. * You received an abundance of graces, * and now, together with Elijah, * you intercede fervently with Christ our God for all of us.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: Hail, wise prophet Elisha! * Having purified your heart of all carnal pleasures, * you gloriously received the lights of the Spirit * which you radiantly communicated to all. * You were totally transfigured in light; * thus you dwell in the presence of the never-setting Light, * and you ceaselessly pray for us who acclaim you.

O father Methodius, wise in God, * you were like a lion * that by the roaring of your all-wise teachings * terrified John the Grammarian, that sly fox, * for he could not endure  your denunciation, * and, as a wicked wretch, was felled by a blow from your sword. * As a champion of true believers, therefore, * you did not leave the flock of Christ to perish.

Today the divine coming of the prophets * has shone forth, mystically beckoning to the souls of those * who love the feasts of the Church. * The one who mounted the chariot which traverses the heavens, * the star of the never-setting East, * together with Elisha, the wondrous man, * widens the streams of the new Jordan, * making clear the proclamation of piety, * and clearly portraying by a double image * the twofold blessing of the harmonious glory of the Old and  New * for those who  celebrate their most festive memorial with faith.

stichera_aposticha.text: Today the Church of God is clothed for a feast * and joyously cries aloud: * My beauty shines more brightly than any city: * behold, the treasure of bishops, the glorious Methodius, arrives in Heaven! * Come, feast-lovers! * All you true Christians, gather together! * Let us draw healing in abundance from the holy relics, * and let us entreat Christ our God * to deliver the world from all heresy!
stichera_aposticha.verse: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.

stichera_aposticha.text: O prophet and herald of Christ, * you have never departed from the throne of his majesty, * and, ministering in the highest, * you always intercede for everyone who is sick. * Wholly glorious, you bless the whole world. * Ask for cleansing for our souls.
stichera_aposticha.verse: Your priests will be clothed with righteousness and your saints will rejoice.

prokeimenon.text: You are a priest forever * according to the order of Melchizedek.
prokeimenon.verse: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand * till I make your enemies your footstool.

verses: Moses and Aaron were among his priests; Samuel was among those who called upon his name.
Light dawns for the just, and gladness for the upright of heart.

communion_hymn.text: . The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear.

main.text: As we celebrate the memory of your prophet Amos, O Lord, * we implore you to save our souls through his prayers.

additional.text: Having given honor to Wisdom, you were honored by him * with heavenly gifts, O venerable Father Jerome.  * You lived on earth as an angel and became a brilliant light.  * Therefore, we celebrate your holy memory.  * We raise our voices in song: glory to him whom you served by your knowledge; * glory to him who performed wonders through you; * glory to him who bestows the grace of salvation on us by your prayers.
As we celebrate the memory of your prophet Amos, O Lord, * we implore you to save our souls through his prayers.

Having given honor to Wisdom, you were honored by him * with heavenly gifts, O venerable Father Jerome.  * You lived on earth as an angel and became a brilliant light.  * Therefore, we celebrate your holy memory.  * We raise our voices in song: glory to him whom you served by your knowledge; * glory to him who performed wonders through you; * glory to him who bestows the grace of salvation on us by your prayers.

main.text: Purifying your heart by the Spirit, * you accepted the gift of prophecy.  * You stood up and shouted your message:  * This is our God, and you shall have none before him.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: O prophet, in the purity of your heart, *  the Light of the Spirit has found a mirror reflecting its radiance. * It has made the knowledge of God shine upon the world, * and it foretold * in images the mysteries of God * and the grace which all were to receive.
As we celebrate the memory of your prophet Amos, O Lord, * we implore you to save our souls through his prayers.

Having given honor to Wisdom, you were honored by him * with heavenly gifts, O venerable Father Jerome.  * You lived on earth as an angel and became a brilliant light.  * Therefore, we celebrate your holy memory.  * We raise our voices in song: glory to him whom you served by your knowledge; * glory to him who performed wonders through you; * glory to him who bestows the grace of salvation on us by your prayers.

prokeimenon.text: You are a priest forever * according to the order of Melchizedek.
prokeimenon.verse: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand * till I make your enemies your footstool.

verses: Moses and Aaron were among his priests; Samuel was among those who called upon his name.
Light dawns for the just, and gladness for the upright of heart.

communion_hymn.text: . The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear.

16.saint: Our holy father Tychon the Wonder-worker

main.text:
,   You first crucified yourself to the world * by    becoming poor among the living. * Then like a true shepherd, * 
    you put your llfe at the disposal of your flock. * Enrichlng    your sheep with miracles, * you became a bright light for the 
    Church of Amathis. * By shedding light on it, you saved it    from the fog of deceit, O father Tychon. * By your prayers 
    enlighten us today as we praise you.

additional.text:
,   You first crucified yourself to the world * by    becoming poor among the living. * Then like a true shepherd, * 
    you put your llfe at the disposal of your flock. * Enrichlng    your sheep with miracles, * you became a bright light for the 
    Church of Amathis. * By shedding light on it, you saved it    from the fog of deceit, O father Tychon. * By your prayers 
    enlighten us today as we praise you.

main.text:
You persevered in fasting through your love for    God, * and heaven sent you the power to expose the lies of 
    idols, * to save the people and cast out devils, * to heal 
    illness by the power of the Comforter.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text:
Living an angelic life, * you 
    became a vessel of God  
    through abstinence from pleasures. * ; wherefore divine grace fittingly elevated you to be a pillar and support for  the Faith. * For your people, you were a chief shepherd leadaing the flock of the Lord * to pastures near the waters of Orthodoxy, * O thrice-blessed hierarch Tychon, inspired by God.

,   You first crucified yourself to the world * by    becoming poor among the living. * Then like a true shepherd, * 
    you put your llfe at the disposal of your flock. * Enrichlng    your sheep with miracles, * you became a bright light for the 
    Church of Amathis. * By shedding light on it, you saved it    from the fog of deceit, O father Tychon. * By your prayers 
    enlighten us today as we praise you.

prokeimenon.text: Precious in the eyes of the Lord * is the death of his faithful.
prokeimenon.verse: What can I return to the Lord for all he has given me?

verses: Happy the man who fears the Lord and greatly delights in his command.
His posterity will be mighty upon the earth.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

17.saint: The holy martyrs Manuel, Sabel, and Ishmael

main.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

additional.text: Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: O blessed martyrs, because of your perfect faith in Christ, * you drank of the cup of sufferings with generous hearts.  * You renounced the idols of Persia, * and proclaimed your belief in the Holy Trinity.  * O trinity of martyrs, intercede for us at all times.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: Like stars of surpassing splendor, * O all-praised passion-bearers, * you illumine the end of the world with divine light, * dispelling the darkness of demons, * the corrupting passions and misfortunes. * We therefore have assembled today, * and we praise your light-bearing and holy feast, O glorious ones.

By pure and sincere love for you, O Word of God, * the holy martyrs put an end to the worship of fire; * and leaving the land of the Chaldeans, * they burned with your own light. * Protected by the armor of faith, * they confounded the tyrant Julian. * The illustrious Manuel, the ever-to-be-remembered Sabel, * and the thrice-blessed Ishmael, * sing to you with the Father and the Spirit, * and they intercede for the salvation of th world.

Your holy martyrs, O Lord our God, * in their struggles, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, they brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through their prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

prokeimenon.text: God is wondrous in his saints, the God of Israel.
prokeimenon.verse: In the churches bless God; from Israel's wellsprings bless the Lord.

verses: The just cried out and the Lord heard them, and rescued them from all their distress.
Many are the trials of the just, but from them all the Lord will rescue them.

communion_hymn.text:
. 
    Rejoice in the Lord, you righteous ones; praise from the upright is fitting. Alleluia! Alleluia! Alleluia!

main.text: Your  martyr Leontius, O Lord our God, * in his struggle, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, he brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through his prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

additional.text: Your  martyr Leontius, O Lord our God, * in his struggle, received an incorruptible crown from you. * With your strength, he brought down the tyrants * and broke the cowardly valor of demons. * Through his prayers, O Christ our God, save our souls.

main.text: You showed the evil treachery of the torturers * and you prevailed against the false worship of the Greeks.  * You presented the knowledge of God in piety to all people. * For all of this, we honor you with love, O wise Leontius.

stichera_lord_i_cried.text: What shall we call you, O illustrious martyr? * An oblation from Greece, since it is your homeland? * The purification of Phoenicia, since there you were sacrificed? * A light shining in the darkness, * a valiant combatant, unbowed beneath the blows? * Manifold is your glory, O blessed Leontius! * Intercede for the salvation of our souls.

O all-praised athlete Leontius! * Neither fire nor wounding now nor the sword * were able to separate you from the love of Christ; * but, suffering manfully in the midst of your torturers, * you abolished the offerings made to idols, * O divinely-wise bearer of the crown of martyrdom, * and now you dance in the heavens! * Intercede for the salvation of our souls.

stichera_aposticha.text: Let heaven revel in splendor today, * and let us, the earthly faithful, * rejoice in the memory of the martyr Leontius; * for this day is crowned, not with the sacrifices of beasts, * but with the sacrifice of praise, with spiritual flowers. * For, standing with us as one adorned, * offering up the unbloody Sacrifice to the Bestower of Crowns, * he radiantly offers up intercession * that those who faithfully keep his memory * may attain the course of Paradise.
stichera_aposticha.verse: The holy martyr Leontius, soldier at Tripoli in Phoenicia, who, having suffered patiently harsh tortures in prison, was granted the crown of martyrdom in the reign of the emperor Vespasian. (c. 73)

prokeimenon.text: The just man will rejoice in the Lord, * and will put his trust in him.
prokeimenon.verse: Hear my voice, O God, when I pray to you.

verses: The just man will flourish like the palm tree * and grow like a cedar of Lebanon.
Planted in the house of the Lord, he will flourish in the courts of our God.

communion_hymn.text: . The just man will be remembered forever; evil news he will not fear.

19.saint: The holy apostle Jude, brother of the Lord,

main.text: We recognize that you are a relative of the Lord, * and a strong martyr who trampled on lies. * We have come to praise you in a sacred manner, O Jude, * as we celebrate your holy memory * and make our plea: * Forgive our sins by the light of your prayers.
